00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem implemenation.
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem
00005  *  (BBSSP) that's used as a lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP objective
00006  *  value.
00007  *
00008  *  @author  John LaRusic
00009  *  @ingroup lib
00010  ****************************************************************************/
00011 #include "arrow.h"
00012 
00013 /****************************************************************************
00014  * Private function prototypes
00015  ****************************************************************************/
00016 /**
00017  *  @brief  Recursively searches for articulation points in the graph using
00018  *          only costs less than or equal to 'max_cost' out from the given
00019  *          node.
00020  *  @param  problem [in] problem data structure
00021  *  @param  max_cost [in] the largest cost to consider as being in the graph
00022  *  @param  node [in] the node to search outward from
00023  *  @param  depth_num [in] level at which the given node was first discovered
00024  *  @param  root_children [in] count of the number of children of the root
00025  *  @param  visited [out] indicates if a node has been visited or not
00026  *  @param  depth [out] indicates the discovery depth of a node
00027  *  @param  low [out] indicates a back edge for some descendent of a node
00028  *              (e.g. the discovery depth of the node closest to the root and
00029  *              reachable from the given node by following zero or more edges
00030  *              downward and then at most one back edge)
00031  *  @param  parent [out] indicates the closest "parent" of a node
00032  *  @param  art_point [out] indicates if the node is an articulation point
00033  */
00034 int
00035 find_art_points(arrow_problem *problem, int max_cost, int node, int depth_num, 
00036                 int root_children, int *visited, int *depth, int *low, 
00037                 int *parent, int *art_point);
00038 
00039 
00040 /****************************************************************************
00041  * Public function implemenations
00042  ****************************************************************************/
00043 int
00044 arrow_bbssp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00045                   arrow_bound_result *result)
00046 {
00047     int ret;
00048     int low, high, median;
00049     int connected;
00050     double start_time, end_time;
00051     
00052     if(!problem->symmetric)
00053     {
00054         arrow_print_error("Solver only works on symmetric cost matrices.");
00055         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00056     }
00057     
00058     /* Start binary search */
00059     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00060     low = 0;
00061     high = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00062     while(low != high)
00063     {
00064         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00065         
00066         /* Determine is graph is biconnected if we consider only costs less
00067          * than or equal to the median value. */
00068         ret = arrow_bbssp_biconnected(problem, info->cost_list[median],
00069                                       &connected);
00070         
00071         if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL)
00072         {
00073             result->obj_value = -1;
00074             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00075         }  
00076         else
00077         {
00078             if(connected == ARROW_TRUE)
00079                 high = median;
00080             else
00081                 low = median + 1;
00082         }
00083     }
00084     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00085     
00086     /* Return the cost we converged to as the answer */
00087     result->obj_value = info->cost_list[low];
00088     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00089     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 int
00094 arrow_bbssp_biconnected(arrow_problem *problem, int max_cost, int *result)
00095 {
00096     int ret;
00097     int u;
00098     int *visited;
00099     int *depth;
00100     int *low;
00101     int *parent;
00102     int *art_point;
00103     
00104     visited = NULL;
00105     depth = NULL;
00106     low = NULL;
00107     parent = NULL;
00108     art_point = NULL;
00109 
00110     /* Initialize all the necessary arrays */
00111     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &visited);
00112     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP; 
00113 
00114     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &depth);
00115     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP;
00116 
00117     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &low);
00118     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP;
00119 
00120     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &parent);
00121     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP;
00122 
00123     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &visited);
00124     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP;
00125 
00126     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &art_point);
00127     if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL) goto CLEANUP;
00128 
00129     /* Set the default values for each array */
00130     for(u = 0; u < problem->size; u++)
00131     {
00132         visited[u] = 0;
00133         depth[u] = -1;
00134         low[u] = INT_MAX;
00135         parent[u] = -1;
00136         art_point[u] = 0;
00137     }
00138 
00139     /* We start by assuming the graph is biconnected */
00140     *result = ARROW_TRUE;
00141     
00142     /* Find any and all articulation points from the first vertex */
00143     ret = find_art_points(problem, max_cost, 0, 0, 0, visited, depth, low, 
00144                           parent, art_point);
00145     
00146     /* Check for articulation points or unvisited nodes */
00147     for(u = 0; u < problem->size; u++)
00148     {
00149         if(!visited[u] || art_point[u])
00150             *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00151     }
00152     
00153 CLEANUP:
00154     if(visited != NULL) free(visited);   
00155     if(depth != NULL) free(depth);   
00156     if(low != NULL) free(low); 
00157     if(parent != NULL) free(parent);
00158     if(art_point != NULL) free(art_point);   
00159     
00160     return ret;
00161 }
00162 
00163 
00164 /****************************************************************************
00165  * Private function implemenations
00166  ****************************************************************************/
00167 int
00168 find_art_points(arrow_problem *problem, int max_cost, int node, int depth_num, 
00169                 int root_children, int *visited, int *depth, int *low, 
00170                 int *parent, int *art_point)
00171 {
00172     /* "u" is the current node, and "v" will represent adjecent nodes */
00173     int u, v;
00174     
00175     /* 
00176        Some explanation of these variables:
00177        - depth_num is the level at which we first discovered node u
00178        - visited[u] indicates if node u has been visited or not
00179        - depth[u] indicates the discovery depth of node u
00180        - low[u] = 
00181             min{d[u], d[w] |(v,w) is a back edge for some descendent v of u}
00182          i.e. the discovery depth of the vertex closest to the root and
00183          reachable from node u by following zero or more edges downward, and
00184          then at most one back edge  
00185     */
00186     u = node;
00187     visited[u] = 1;
00188     depth[u] = depth_num;
00189     low[u] = depth_num;
00190     depth_num++;
00191     
00192     /* Look at nodes adjacent to u */
00193     for(v = 0; v < problem->size; v++)
00194     {
00195         if(problem->get_cost(problem, u, v) <= max_cost)
00196         {
00197             /* If the node has yet to be visited, mark its parent as u */
00198             if(!visited[v])
00199             {
00200                 parent[v] = u;
00201                 
00202                 /* If this is the parent, increase root_children count */
00203                 if(parent[u] == -1) root_children++;
00204                 
00205                 /* Recurse on v */
00206                 find_art_points(problem, max_cost, v, depth_num, 
00207                                 root_children, visited, depth, low, 
00208                                 parent, art_point);
00209                 
00210                 /* Update low[u] */
00211                 if(low[v] < low[u]) low[u] = low[v];
00212                 
00213                 /* Check articulation point conditions */
00214                 if(parent[u] == -1)
00215                 {
00216                     if(root_children > 1)
00217                     {
00218                         art_point[u] = 1;
00219                     }
00220                 }
00221                 else if(low[v] >= depth[u])
00222                 {
00223                     art_point[u] = 1;
00224                 }
00225             }
00226             /* Check to see if edge is a back edge */
00227             else if(v != parent[u])
00228             {
00229                 if(depth[v] < low[u]) low[u] = depth[v];
00230             }
00231         }
00232     }
00233     
00234     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00235 }
